UpperArmsCBConcentrationCurl.name: Cable Concentration Curl
UpperArmsCBConcentrationCurl.preparation: Facing low pulley cable, sit on seat or bench with legs apart to each side. Grasp stirrup attachment. Place upper arm against inner thigh.
UpperArmsCBConcentrationCurl.execution: Pull stirrup to front of shoulder until elbow is completely flexed. Lower stirrup until arm is fully extended. Repeat. Continue with opposite arm.
UpperArmsCBConcentrationCurl.comments: The long head (lateral head) of biceps brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of biceps brachii since short head enters into active insufficiency as it continues to contract.
UpperArmsCBConcentrationCurl.stabilizers: trapeziusupper, trapeziusmiddle, erectorspinae, levatorscapulae, wristflexors, obliques

UpperArmsCBPreacherCurl.name: Cable Preacher Curl
UpperArmsCBPreacherCurl.preparation: Sit on preacher bench placing back of arms on pad. Grasp cable bar with shoulder width underhand grip.
UpperArmsCBPreacherCurl.execution: Raise cable bar toward shoulders. Lower cable bar until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
UpperArmsCBPreacherCurl.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow arm pit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. The long head (lateral head) of biceps brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of biceps brachii since short head enters into active insufficiency as it continues to contract. At bottom position, weight stack in use should not make contact with remaining weight stack. Also see movement on horizontal pad.

UpperArmsCBAlternatingPreacherCurl.name: Cable Alternating Preacher Curl
UpperArmsCBAlternatingPreacherCurl.preparation: Grasp cable stirrups with each hand. Sit on preacher bench placing back of arms on pad with palms up.
UpperArmsCBAlternatingPreacherCurl.execution: Raise one stirrup upward toward shoulder of same arm. Lower stirrup until arm is fully extended. Repeat with opposite arm. Continue alternating between arms.
UpperArmsCBAlternatingPreacherCurl.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow arm pit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arms should remain on pad throughout movement. The long head (lateral head) of biceps brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of biceps brachii since short head enters into active insufficiency as it continues to contract. At bottom position, weight stack in use should not make contact with remaining weight stack.

UpperArmsCBStandingPreacherCurl.name: Cable Standing Preacher Curl
UpperArmsCBStandingPreacherCurl.preparation: Stand behind preacher bench. Grasp cable bar with shoulder width underhand grip. Position back of arms on pad.
UpperArmsCBStandingPreacherCurl.execution: Raise cable bar toward shoulders. Lower cable bar until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
UpperArmsCBStandingPreacherCurl.comments: Feet can be staggered and bent slightly (if needed) to allow arm pit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. The long head (lateral head) of biceps brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of biceps brachii since short head enters into active insufficiency as it continues to contract. At bottom position, weight stack in use should not make contact with remaining weight stack. Also see movement on horizontal pad.

UpperArmsCBOneArmStandingPreacherCurl.name: Cable One Arm Standing Preacher Curl
UpperArmsCBOneArmStandingPreacherCurl.preparation: Standing behind standing preacher bench and grasp cable stirrup. Place back of arm on pad with palm up.
UpperArmsCBOneArmStandingPreacherCurl.execution: Raise stirrup upward toward shoulder of same arm. Lower stirrup until arm is fully extended. Repeat.
UpperArmsCBOneArmStandingPreacherCurl.comments: Stirrup can be hung from one side of rack for easier access. Feet can be staggered and bent slightly (if needed) to allow arm pit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. The long head (lateral head) of biceps brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of biceps brachii since short head enters into active insufficiency as it continues to contract. At bottom position, weight stack in use should not make contact with remaining weight stack.

UpperArmsCBOneArmPreacherCurl.name: Cable One Arm Preacher Curl
UpperArmsCBOneArmPreacherCurl.preparation: Grasp cable stirrup. Sit on preacher bench placing back of arm on pad with palm up.
UpperArmsCBOneArmPreacherCurl.execution: Raise stirrup upward toward shoulder of same arm. Lower stirrup until arm is fully extended. Repeat.
UpperArmsCBOneArmPreacherCurl.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow arm pit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arm should remain on pad throughout movement. The long head (lateral head) of biceps brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of biceps brachii since short head enters into active insufficiency as it continues to contract. At bottom position, weight stack in use should not make contact with remaining weight stack.

UpperArmsCBPreacherCurlStirrups.name: Cable Preacher Curl (stirrups)
UpperArmsCBPreacherCurlStirrups.preparation: Grasp cable stirrups with each hand. Sit on preacher bench placing back of arms on pad with palms up.
UpperArmsCBPreacherCurlStirrups.execution: Raise both stirrups upward toward shoulders. Lower stirrups until arm is fully extended. Repeat.
UpperArmsCBPreacherCurlStirrups.comments: Seat should be adjusted to allow arm pit to rest near top of pad. Back of upper arms should remain on pad throughout movement. The long head (lateral head) of biceps brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of biceps brachii since short head enters into active insufficiency as it continues to contract. At bottom position, weight stack in use should not make contact with remaining weight stack.

UpperArmsCBProneInclineCurl.name: Cable Prone Incline Curl
UpperArmsCBProneInclineCurl.preparation: Lie prone on incline bench with shoulders near top of incline. Knees can rest on seat or legs can be straddled to sides. Grasp cable attachment with shoulder width underhand grip.
UpperArmsCBProneInclineCurl.execution: Raise bar until arms are flexed. Lower barbell until arms are fully extended. Repeat.
UpperArmsCBProneInclineCurl.comments: Also known as Cable Spider Curl. The long head (lateral head) of biceps brachii is activated significantly more than short head (medial head) of biceps brachii since short head enters into active insufficiency as it continues to contract.
